Interface PlayerInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ComputerPlayer_xvhn44, HumanPlayer

    public interface PlayerInterface
    This interface represents a player within the game of Hex and the methods that a player should make DO NOT CHANGE THIS FILE
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Stephen McGough

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean finalGameState(GameState state)
      Informs the player of the final game state.
      MoveInterface makeMove(Piece[][] boardView)
      Ask the player to make a move.
      boolean setColour(Piece colour)
      Set the colour that this player will be

    • Method Detail

      • makeMove

        MoveInterface makeMove(Piece[][] boardView)
                throws NoValidMovesException
        Ask the player to make a move.
        Parameters:
        boardView - the current state of the board
        Returns:
        a Move object representing the desired place to place a piece
        Throws:
        NoValidMovesException - Indicates that no valid moves are possible - e.g. all cells on the board are already occupied by a piece.

      • setColour

        boolean setColour(Piece colour)
           throws InvalidColourException,
                  ColourAlreadySetException
        Set the colour that this player will be
        Parameters:
        colour - A Piece (RED/BLUE) that this player will be
        Returns:
        true indicating that the method succeeded
        Throws:
        InvalidColourException - A colour other than RED/BLUE was provided
        ColourAlreadySetException - The colour has already been set for this player.

      • finalGameState

        boolean finalGameState(GameState state)
        Informs the player of the final game state. Player has Won, lost.
        Parameters:
        state - either WON or LOST
        Returns:
        true indicating method has compleated successfully.
